paragraphs.zh-tw: Nicole Paris: TEDYouth, make some noise! (Beatboxing) TEDYouth, make some -- (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing ends) Are you ready? (Cheers and applause) Are you ready? Ed Cage: Yeah, yeah, yeah! (Beatboxing) EC: Y'all like that? Let me show youhow we used to do it -- NP: Get it pops, go ahead. EC: ... when I was growing up in the '90s.
paragraphs.en: 妮可·帕里斯（以下簡稱NP)：TEDYouth的朋友們，發出一些聲響吧！ （Beatboxing) 朋友們，發出一些—— （Beatboxing) (Beatboxing結束） 你們準備好了嗎？ （歡呼和掌聲） 你們準備好了嗎？ 艾德·凱奇（以下簡稱EC）：是的！是的！好了！ (Beatboxing) EC：你們都喜歡嗎？讓我向你們展示我們過去是怎麼做的—— NP：開始吧爸爸！快一點！ EC：在90年代，當我還是個孩子的時候——

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing ends) (Beatboxing) NP: Pops, pops, pops, pops, pops, pops, hold up, hold up, hold up, hold up! Oh my God. OK, he's trying to battle me.
paragraphs.en: (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing結束) (Beatboxing) NP：爸爸，爸爸，爸爸，爸爸， 快停下來，快停下來，快停下來！ 上帝啊 OK，他這是在向我挑戰

paragraphs.zh-tw: Hold on, right now, hold on. Do you remember when you usedto beatbox me to sleep? EC: Yeah, yeah, I remember.
paragraphs.en: 停下來，就是現在，快停下來。 你還記得你曾經用beatbox來哄我入睡嗎？ EC：噢，是的，是的，我記得。

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's when she was a little baby. We would do something like this.
paragraphs.en: 在她還是個嬰兒的時候， 我們確實經常這麼做。

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Beatboxing) NP: I remember that. (Beatboxing) NP: All right, pops, pops, pops,chill out, chill out.
paragraphs.en: (Beatboxing) NP：我記得這段。 (Beatboxing) NP：好了，爸爸，爸爸....冷靜下來，冷靜下來。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Hold up, hold up, hold up. EC: Y'all remember the video.
paragraphs.en: 打住，打住，打住。 EC：你們都將會記得這段視頻，

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is like a little payback or something for 50 million peoplecalling me the loser. NP: Hold up, hold up.
paragraphs.en: 這是作為五百萬人把我看做一個失敗者的小小補償。 。 NP：打住，打住

paragraphs.zh-tw: But a lot of people out there don'treally know what beatboxing is, where it started from. EC: Right, right.
paragraphs.en: 但是有很大一部分人並不知道beatboxing是什麼， 它起源自哪裡， EC: 對，對。 NP：它從哪裡開始傳播。

paragraphs.zh-tw: NP: Where it came from. So why don't you givethem a little history -- just a tickle -- a bit of historyof where it comes from.
paragraphs.en: 哪你為什麼不給他們講點歷史—— 就一小段——關於它起源自哪裡的歷史。

paragraphs.zh-tw: EC: Beatbox started here in New York. (Cheers) That's right, that's right.New York, New York! Everybody like, "Yeah!" Well, we from St. Louis.
paragraphs.en: EC：Beatbox 就是從這裡，紐約，開始發展的。 （歡呼） 是這樣的，是這樣的。 紐約，紐約! 每個人都喜歡，“耶！” 嗯，我們就從聖路易開始說起吧。

paragraphs.zh-tw: NP: Now you can put y'all hands down. EC: But beatbox started here in New York.
paragraphs.en: NP：現在你們都可以把手放下來了。 EC：但是Beatbox 是從紐約開始發展的。

paragraphs.zh-tw: What you would have is that,when we would go to parties, you would have the DJand you would have the rapper. But because I don't haveelectricity coming out of me, we had to emulatewhat the beats was doing.
paragraphs.en: 當我們去參加聚會的時候， 你有DJ，你也有說唱樂手， 但是因為我沒法產生電流 所以我們只能模仿電子節奏的聲音

paragraphs.zh-tw: So when you would see the beatboxer, you would see us over to the side. Then you would see a rapper,and when the rapper began to rap, we would do a simple beat, because back then the beats were simple -- (Beatboxing) or -- (Beatboxing) Those were simple beats.
paragraphs.en: 所以你能夠看到beatbox樂手的地方 就在樂隊旁邊。 然後你可以看到一個說唱樂手，並且當他開始說唱的時候， 我們會給一個簡單的節奏 因為在那個時候節奏都是很簡單的—— (Beatboxing) 或者—— (Beatboxing) 這些都是簡單的節奏。

paragraphs.zh-tw: But now, you got folks that wantto do all type of stuff with their beats now, and they want to humiliate their father, which is not right when you wantto humiliate the person that take care of you, payall your tuition, (Nicole laughs) especially when you have 50 million people that just go aroundand call you "the loser." Well, I'm taking that to heart. But now we do somethingdifferent in our house, so we have these jam sessions, and our jam sessions consistof us jamming in church.
paragraphs.en: 但是現在，人們想要用beatbox做所有的東西 並且他們想要羞辱他們的父親， 這是不對的。 那麼就小心一點吧，盡全力演講，（NP笑） 尤其當你有五千萬觀眾的時候， 他們只會到處走然後叫你”失敗者“。 嗯，我會牢牢記著這個仇的。 但是現在，我們會在家裡做一些不同的事， 所以我們有了這些即興演奏， 並且這些即興演奏也包括我們擠在教堂裡的時候。

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know, in church,we'll look at each other like, (Beatboxing) and we'll text the beat to each other. Or we'll be in the kitchen cooking, road trips, airports.
paragraphs.en: 你知道嗎，在教堂里，我們就樣互相看著對方然後—— (Beatboxing) 然後我們會把節奏發短信給對方。 或者，我們也會在廚房裡， 旅遊時，在機場里即興演奏。

paragraphs.zh-tw: NP: Standing right there in the corner,"Aw, Dad -- listen to that." (Beatboxing) Naw, I'm kidding. But you know what? We're talking all about thisjam session and everything. EC: Yeah.
paragraphs.en: NP：站在角落里，“噢爸爸——聽聽這個。” (Beatboxing) 哈哈，我是開玩笑的。但是你知道嗎？ 我們一直在討論這些即興演奏。 EC：是的。

paragraphs.zh-tw: NP: Why don't we give them a little peek,just a tiny bit of our jam session? NP: Y'all want to hear some jam session?EC: Y'all ready for a jam session? (Cheers) NP: Sorry? I can't hear you. (Cheers) Yeah! Kick it, pops! (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing ends) NP: I'm getting ready to go! EC: Y'all ready? Everybody stand up!Come on, everybody stand up! Get on up! Come on, stretch! (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing ends) NP: That's it.
paragraphs.en: NP：那為什麼不給他們表演一段，只要即興演奏里的一小段呢？ NP：你們都想要聽一下嗎？EC：你們都準備好了嗎？ （歡呼） NP：對不起？我好像聽不到啊。 （歡呼） 噢，瘋狂起來吧，爸爸！ (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing結束) NP：我要準備開始了！ EC：你們都準備好了嗎？大家都站起來！快點啊，大家都站起來！ 繼續！跟上來啊，竭盡你們所能！ (Beatboxing) (Beatboxing結束) NP:：就是這樣。

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Cheers and applause) Thank you! Make some noise! EG: Thank you, everybody! NP: Make some noise! Make some noise! Thank you!
paragraphs.en: （歡呼和掌聲） 謝謝你們！躁動一下吧！ EC：謝謝你們！ NP：躁動起來吧！ 謝謝你們！

title: Nicole Paris And Ed Cage A Beatboxing Lesson From A Father Daughter Duo
